title: Understanding Relative Frequency
text: Relative frequency is calculated by dividing the number of people who prefer a specific fruit by the total number of people surveyed.

title: Calculate Relative Frequency for Apples
text: To find the relative frequency of people who prefer apples, divide the number of apple lovers by the total number of participants.

title: Calculate Relative Frequency for Bananas
text: Similarly, calculate the relative frequency for bananas by dividing the number of banana lovers by the total number of participants.

title: Compare the Relative Frequencies
text: Compare the relative frequency of apples to that of bananas. Is the relative frequency of apples greater?
